TopicTitle: Weird anomaly: apparently Kerbals are able to change their gender.

Articles.Content:
No, I'm not being a A-hole. This actually happened on my copy of KSP 1.04.

Valentina went from a Female to a male mid-game, the persistent file and game save confirm she was male (!?) and eventho' I changed her back, the game still showed her as male.

I ended up pulling all my mod files and restarting the game all over again with stock parts EXCEPT for Pilot Assist.

Like I said, I'm not joking around.
What if they added it deliberately as a small percent chance, in an effort to further trans-persons equality?
Could well be a mod bug. Any mods that mess with Kerbals are obvious suspects.

> 
> Could well be a mod bug. Any mods that mess with Kerbals are obvious suspects.

I currently have a contract pack that makes all rescue contracts spawn 100% boys in distress and no damsels. I am serious, and don't call me Shirley.

To tell you all the truth I'm not sure if this is a bug or something I or a mod did.

I'm going to add one mod at at time and see if this replicates.

I'll start with Texture Replacer and go from there, since it changes how the Kerbals look in the suits. Have to start somewhere.....

> 
> To tell you all the truth I'm not sure if this is a bug or something I or a mod did.
> I'm going to add one mod at at time and see if this replicates.
> 
> I'll start with Texture Replacer and go from there, since it changes how the Kerbals look in the suits. Have to start somewhere.....

Texture Replacer has an option to make all girls into males to have custom textures and stuff. So that must be it.

Confirmed: Texture Replacer is the culprit.

It's rewriting the persistent file and changing Valentina to male. Did it 3 times out of 3 on a new restarted game.

Removed Texture Replacer, fixed the persistent file and the last save. She's back to normal.

But not a severe bug in my opinion...

Aha! *That's* the issue! A week or two ago I was having difficulties changing my kerbals' genders (on purpose, rather than OP's problem) but they kept switching back. Good to know TextureReplacer is the culprit...

That bug sounds terrible.

Although I have to say, a story could be made out of this.

*Valentina Kerman, one of the bravest astronauts from Kerbin, was alone on her interplanetary ship, on a mission to Jool. It took years in order to build it, and now was the moment of truth. Would kerbal engineering take their civilization to a new level? 50% chances.*

*In LKO orbit, Valentina pushed the burn info into the ship's autopilot, and everything was going well. She decided to do the last remaining tasks and call it a day.*

*The next day, Valentina woke up, feeling different. She looked at her hands, and their size was a bit different, something weird, but she assumed it was the zero-g environment's fault. But not only her hands were different, things were quite strange. Her voice's pitch had lowered and her head was somewhat bigger. As she went to the station's bathroom, she looked at the mirror. Her head was square! How shocking! How could that be? Could her lower body have been affected too?*

*Valentina was dying to urinate, so she lowered her pants, only to find out that her lower body had also been affected. "Damn you, Kraken!" Valentina swore, after noticing that the device used to dispose her waste was specifically designed for female kerbals, since she/he was the only one in the station.*

*At the KSC, a male voice came up on the radio.*

*"KSC, we have a problem."*
